active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of centralized versus decentralized log aggregation: How does centralization improve threat detection (e.g., via SIEM correlation), but what scalability and single-point-of-failure risks does it introduce? Reference NIST SP 800-92 and real-world examples like a ransomware incident.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Topic: Centralized Log Aggregation (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Software Security Effectiveness > 006_Operational Security and Monitoring > Security Monitoring and Logging > Centralized Log Aggregation). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding (with content, quizzes, sources), and flashcard schema to generate high-quality, pedagogically optimized flashcards. Incorporate: - Bloom's progression: Mix REMEMBER (defs), UNDERSTAND/ APPLY (lifecycle/steps), ANALYZE/EVALUATE/CREATE (comparisons/designs). - Scaffolding: Tag each card with layer (e.g., #Layer1). - Active Learning: 20% of cards reference discussion/activities (e.g., 'Relate to scenario in problem-solving exercise'). - Voter Priorities: Ensure completeness (full best practices, sources), pedagogy (assessments, prior links). - Distractors: Plausible per protocol. Output ONLY a JSON array of 30 flashcards, each matching the schema exactly (MCQ: 10, Cloze: 10, Q&A: 10). No extra text.
